Instrument.name: The Grain Impact Analyset and Dust Accumulator (GIADA) for the Rosetta Orbiter
Instrument.description: The GIADA experiment included three different sensing methods for detecting dust entering the instrument. A Grain Detection System could detect the entry of individual grains into GIADA optically, without affecting its dynamic properties. An Impact Sensor used piezoelectric sensors to monitor the momentum released by the grain when it impacted an aluminum plate.Five Micro Balance Systems, oriented in different spatial directions, measured the cumulative deposit of fine dust over time.
